title: Business Development Representative - DACH Region (GER/FIN/SWE/NOR)
description:
**Who we are:** 




 With the M-Files platform, knowledge workers can find information faster, work smarter, and achieve more. M-Files features an innovative metadata-driven architecture, embedded workflow engine, and advanced artificial intelligence. This enables customers to eliminate information chaos, improve process efficiency, and automate security and compliance.
 



 We help knowledge workers to work smarter. To learn more about us we encourage you to visit our .
   

  

 We are now looking for
 **Business Development Representatives (BDR)** 
 to support our growing sales activities in DACH region. This role can be based in Germany, Finland, Sweden or Norway.
   

  

 As a
 **BDR** 
 , you will play a critical role in driving our success. You will need to grasp the fundamentals of the M-Files intelligent information management software, have an engaging personality and professional approach that will enable you to connect with prospective customers, evaluate their needs and communicate how M-Files will improve their business in order to agree on meetings with our sales representatives to proceed with the sales process.
 



**Responsibilities:** 



* Prospect, and contact new prospective customer accounts
* Research and identify prospective customer contacts using company websites, web searches, networking tools such as LinkedIn and other social media tools
* Qualify potential customers
* Qualify, route and nurture both Inbound and outbound prospects to the appropriate M-Files Sales Representative or business segment
* Clearly communicate to prospects and customers the value of M-Files products
* Conduct online M-Files demos and meetings with prospective customers
* Build qualified sales pipeline
* Support early stages of sales process and work in close collaboration
  

  


**Requirements**
* Business Development
 **(BDR)** 
 experience in a technology-centric environment
* Experience in generating leads & success in outbound and inbound prospecting
* An ability to listen to the customer and translate their needs into actionable pre-sales tasks and new business proposals
* Taking pleasure in reaching out to new clients and implementing effective prospecting strategies
* A proactive growth mindset focused on achieving targets and a strong enthusiasm for working in a dynamic and ever-evolving environment
* Experience in a customer-facing position (such as consultant, sales engineer, or sales representative) is highly preferred, particularly with one or more of the following focus areas: Document Management, Database, ERP, Integration, or CRM solutions
* Experience in the energy, oil and gas, and manufacturing sectors is beneficial as well as previous work experience in SAAS business
* Fluent English and German and strong verbal & written communication skills. Nordic languages are considered as an asset
* Experience using CRM systems (e.g. SalesForce)
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office & Windows applications
  

  


**Benefits**

**What We Offer:** 



* International team of top performers
* Inclusive and dynamic culture (virtual and in-person)
* Opportunity to contribute to our success and growth globally
* Flexible work/life balance
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Recruitment Referral Program
* Years in Service Awards
* Auntie Service (Therapy & Wellbeing)
   

  

  

 We are a global company with Finnish roots and a strong passion for delivering innovative solutions that transform industries. By joining M-Files, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of knowledge work automation while growing your expertise in a collaborative and supportive environment.
   

  

 Our guiding principles of "
 **Make It Happen** 
 ", "
 **Help Others** 
 ", and "
 **Love Customers** 
 " are highlighted through our daily actions as a team. Transparent communication and outstanding team spirit were listed as our strengths in our M-Filer Experience survey.
   

  

**Does this sound exciting to you?
   

  

 Application Timeline:** 
  Due to the ongoing holiday season, the application period is open until 
 **August 10th, 2025** 
 . We will begin reviewing applications and scheduling interviews 
 **after this date** 
 .
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept applications sent via email. All applications should be submitted through job boards like LinkedIn or our career portal. Due to the high volume of applications, we will not be able to respond to all LinkedIn InMails.
   

  

**Please note that we are unable to offer relocation support for this position. Applicants must already hold valid residency and work authorization in Germany, Finland, Sweden, or Norway.**
 Join M-Files and help industry leaders transform the way they manage information and drive business success!

title: Legal Counsel
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.
   

  

 This Position reports to:
   

  

 Division Lead Counsel IAEN
   

  

**Your Role: Own the Challenge**
 Are you ready to make a strategic impact in a global technology leader? In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring that ABB continues to operate with the highest standards of ethics, integrity, and legal compliance. As Legal Counsel, you will act as a trusted advisor to ABB’s management and business stakeholders, offering expert legal guidance that supports both operational decisions and long-term strategy.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include managing legal risks, ensuring compliance with laws and regulations, and promoting a strong integrity culture across the organization. You’ll review and negotiate commercial contracts, draft legal agreements, and support contract management in close collaboration with both business teams and colleagues within the Legal & Integrity (L&I) function.
   

  

 You will work closely with the existing Legal Counsel for Process Automation while also being part of ABB’s global Legal & Integrity community—an international team of highly skilled professionals across multiple jurisdictions.
   

  

 At ABB, we deliver integrated automation, electrical and digital solutions for customers in the process, hybrid, and marine industries. Our deep industry expertise, combined with cutting-edge technology, helps drive productivity, energy efficiency, sustainability, and safety in industrial operations worldwide.
   

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provides end-to-end legal services to the Process Automation Business Area units in Sweden.
* Reviews and negotiates contracts, drafts commercial agreements and other contractual terms in collaboration with relevant business stakeholders, covering projects within Sweden and abroad.
* Provides legal and integrity related advice and acts as a business partner and advisor to the business stakeholders and occupies a seat at the table on local strategic business matters.
* Supports on legal issues in execution, including claim prevention and management, and where needed manages litigations.
* Supports where required with respect to Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A)/divestiture and investment transactions, including due diligence and integration activities.
* Supports anticipating future business and legal opportunities and challenges and developing appropriate legal strategies to address them.
* Identifies risks, external threats, and opportunities to the company, proactively and proposes appropriate strategies.


**Qualifications**
* Possession of a Swedish law degree.
* 5 – 10 years of legal experience, preferably from working as an in-house counsel in a multinational company with technology focus. Candidates with experience in technology or project contracts from a well-recognized law firm will also be considered.
* Experience from working in multiple jurisdictions and from providing cross-border legal support
* Experience relevant industries – energy, mining, battery manufacturing, pulp and paper, automation is meriting, but not a must
* Good interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills and being able to work effectively with business clients.
* Fluency in English and Swedish is a must.


**Why ABB?**
 We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.
   

  

 Be part of something bigger. This is where progress is powered, teams initiate action, and we move the world forward together. Run What Runs the World.
   

  

  

**More About Us**
 ABB provides a comprehensive range of integrated automation, electrical and digital systems and services for customers in the process, hybrid and maritime industries. These offerings, coupled with deep domain knowledge in each end market, help to optimize productivity, energy efficiency, sustainability and safety of industrial processes and operations.
   

  

 Legal Counsel: Marcus Bergström +46724644673, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Torbjörn Eriksson, +46 702 08 99 50; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Tony Johansson, +46 730 66 99 06. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Irma Leijon, +46724612314.
   

  

 We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is August 11, 2025. Please note that the interview process is ongoing, apply now to secure your spot in the recruitment process!
   

  

 Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.
   

  

 We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Technical Consultant Unit4 - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Vill du bli en del av ett engagerat och prestigelöst team som kombinerar teknisk kompetens med genuin vilja att skapa värde? Vi har stora tillväxtambitioner och behöver fler konsulter för att bygga vår enhet starkare. Därför söker vi nu efter en teknisk konsult till vår Unit4 verksamhet på Tietoevry Tech Services. Hos oss är vardagen omväxlande - du får arbeta i både spännande implementeringsprojekt och i nära samarbete med våra befintliga kunder i förvaltning och vidareutveckla deras lösningar.
   

  

 Har du erfarenhet av ERP system och trivs i en roll där samarbete, problemlösning och systemförståelse står i fokus? Vi söker dig som vill bidra i ett erfaret team inom ett av Nordens största konsultbolag. Där vi har en stark position som Unit4’s största globala partner och ett nätverk med närmare 200 kollegor i Norden.
   

  

**Vem Vi Söker**
* Vi söker en engagerad konsult med stort teknik- och systemintresse som trivs att arbeta med kunder i både team och självständigt.
* Du har en utbildningsbakgrund inom IT; antingen en universitetsutbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller en YH-utbildning som It-tekniker, nätverksspecialist eller liknande.
* Du har några års erfarenhet som exempelvis IT-tekniker, systemadministratör eller konsult.


**Om Rollen**
 I denna roll kommer du att stötta med tekniska och säkerhetsrelaterade frågor kopplade till våra kunder som använder systemet Unit4 ERP, både de som befinner sig i molnet, on prem, och i transiteringen däremellan. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att våra kunder får ut det mesta av sina investeringar i sitt ERP system.
   

  

**Rollen Kommer Innebära Ansvar Inom**
* Hantering av molntjänster, särskilt Microsoft Azure:
+ Administrera och underhålla identiteter, nätverk och säkerhetsprotokoll inom Microsoft Azure.
+ Implementera och övervaka automatiseringslösningar för att förbättra effektiviteten och säkerheten i molnmiljön.

* Autentisering och säkerhet:
+ Implementera och hantera autentiseringslösningar som SSO, SAML, OAuth och Private Key JWT.
+ Hantera certifikat och säkerställa att säkerhetsstandarder och -protokoll följs.

* Ärende- och förändringshantering:
+ Ansvara för ärendehantering och förändringsprocesser enligt ITIL-standarder.
+ Använda servicedeskverktyg för att spåra och lösa tekniska problem.
+ Planera och genomföra releasehanteringsaktiviteter för att säkerställa smidiga uppdateringar och förändringar i systemet.


**Vi Erbjuder Dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du får möjlighet att utvecklas när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Blev du inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, Bård Jörgen Haaland, baard.haaland@tietoevry.com
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
**Om Tietoevry Tech Services**
 Tietoevry Tech Services är en ledande leverantör av transformations- och IT-drifttjänster, med fokus på nordiska privata och offentliga kunder inom olika branscher. Med vårt kompletta utbud av digitala lösningar – inklusive applikationer, multicloud, data & AI samt säkerhetstjänster – hjälper vi företag att utvecklas och håller de nordiska samhällena i gång.
   

  

 Vi är ett globalt team med över 7 000 experter från mer än 50 nationaliteter och levererar tjänster till våra kunder genom att kombinera globala kapabiliteter med nordisk närhet. Ledd av våra värderingar – jämlikhet, transparens och tillit – strävar vi efter att vara den bästa möjliga arbetsplatsen.
   

  

 Nu söker vi talangfulla personer som vill följa med oss på vår spännande resa mot att bli ett självständigt bolag och tillsammans forma det digitala landskapet i Norden.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Teknisk säljare till Measurement & Analytics
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.
   

  

 This Position reports to:
   

  

 Sales Manager
   

  

**Roll och ansvarsområden**
 ABB Measurement & Analytics söker nu en strategisk och resultatorienterad säljare för att driva försäljningen inom produktområdet Gasanalys mot energi- och industrikunder på den svenska marknaden. Du blir en del av ABB Measurement & Analytics, en division inom affärsområdet Process Automation. Vårt fokus är att göra installation, användning och underhåll av instrument och analysatorer så enkelt som möjligt.
   

  

 Du får stor frihet under ansvar i rollen och har möjlighet att påverka både dina arbetsuppgifter och din utveckling. Här får du arbeta med den senaste tekniken i ett kompetent och engagerat team. Rollen innebär frekventa resor, med stort fokus på att bygga starka kundrelationer och förstå kundernas behov direkt på plats. Placeringen är flexibel – du kan utgå från ditt hem, så länge du har goda pendlingsmöjligheter till områden mellan Göteborg och Stockholm.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Som säljare hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att driva och utveckla affärer inom svensk industri, med fokus på branscher som papper & massa samt energisektorn. Du identifierar nya affärsmöjligheter, bygger starka relationer och ser till att både befintliga och nya kunder får innovativa lösningar som skapar värde.
* Du arbetar strategiskt och proaktivt med hög aktivitetsnivå för att maximera kundupplevelsen och säkerställa långsiktiga affärsrelationer.
* Genom att utveckla och genomföra säljaktiviteter enligt vår säljplan, samarbetar du nära våra Account Teams och lokala business centers för att hitta nya vägar till framgång och leverera skräddarsydda lösningar till våra kunder.
* Du äger säljprocessen från första kontakt till avslut, med stöd av våra tekniska säljspecialister och produktchefer. Här får du frihet att ta egna initiativ, samtidigt som du har ett starkt team i ryggen.


**Din bakgrund**
* Du har en teknisk utbildning i grunden och ett starkt intresse för teknik.
* Du har flerårig erfarenhet inom analysteknik.
* Du trivs i kundmöten och har en tydlig kommersiell profil.
* Du har erfarenhet av CRM-system och moderna IT-verktyg.
* Du är strategisk, relationsskapande och skicklig på att navigera inom kunders organisationer.
* Ditt driv och affärssinne kommer tillsammans med din kreativitet vara viktiga framgångsfaktorer.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Det här erbjuder vi dig**
 Vi uppmuntrar dig till att ta initiativ, våga utmana idéer och driva ditt arbete framåt. Här växer du genom meningsfullt arbete och livslångt lärande, där vi stöttar dig längs vägen. Varje idé du delar och varje steg du tar bidrar till något större.
   

  

**Mer om oss**
 Rekryterande chef Mikael Gustavsson +46 724 644 770 svarar gärna på dina frågor kring tjänsten. Fackliga kontaktpersoner: Sveriges Ingenjörer - Jannica Åhman, +46 701 84 31 63, Unionen - Krista Andersson, +4621-34 02 86, Ledarna - Kenneth Wahlqvist, +46 706 52 09 67. Övriga frågor ställs till Talent Partner Irma Leijon, +46 724 612 314.
   

  

 Du är välkommen med din ansökan senast 11 augusti 2025. Vänligen notera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Juli är semestermånad i Sverige, och på ABB tar vi till vara på möjligheten att ladda batterierna. Vi tror på vikten av återhämtning och balans i livet. Det innebär att rekryteringsprocessen kan gå något långsammare – vi hoppas på din förståelse och uppskattar ditt tålamod!
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Fleet Specialist, Hybrid
description:
**Your mission at Voi**
**Responsibilities**
 For the position as a
 **Fleet Specialist** 
 , you'll have the possibility of working in two different areas, depending on workload and suitability. We have our mechanical team, where you will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of our vehicles. This means keeping our scooters in top shape and provide strong support to our team on the ground. We also have our In field team, where you'll be utilising our vans to perform different tasks in the
 **Stockholm** 
 area, making sure our operations runs as efficiently as possible. Here are some exciting tasks awaiting you as a Fleet Specialist:
   

  

* Ensuring the logistics of collecting and providing Voi scooters.⚙️
* Searching for and collecting damaged scooters. 🛴
* Battery replacement.🔋
* Performing quick on-site repairs of the scooters.🔧
* Diagnosing and repairing broken vehicles.🔧
* Recycling and dismantling vehicles that cannot be repaired. ♻️
* Assisting with the acceptance, packaging, and provision of new vehicles and batteries arriving at the warehouse. 🔍
* Supporting our on-site team as needed, whether it's identifying damaged vehicles, clearing parking spaces, or setting up fallen vehicles.🤝


**What You'll Need To Embark**
 We're looking for a highly motivated and responsible team player who can handle tasks and solve problems independently. With a proactive approach, you should be skilled in finding innovative solutions and achieving set objectives. In addition, the right candidate should have:
   

  

* A valid drivers license for Sweden
* Fluent english, both verbal and written and if you're fluent in Swedish it's a plus
* Previous experience with tools or mechanical practices
* General familiarity with digital tools and applications
* Local knowledge of Stockholm and experience driving in the city
* The ability to remain calm in stressful situations (such as difficult parking or traffic)


**Job conditions**
* Working hours: Part time
* Contract type: Fixed term contract (seasonal)
* Start date: To be discussed


**Why Voi?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; It's a Personal Voiage Where You'll Grow As a Professional And Be Part Of a Diverse Team And Culture That's Committed To Making a Positive Impact On Society. In Addition To This, You'll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europe's leading micromobility company and one of the fastest-growing scale-ups
* Make a direct impact on our ongoing success and contribute to the development of the micromobility industry in Sweden.
* Collaborate with inspiring, motivated, and diverse colleagues who share a common goal
* Be a part of the micromobility revolution and help create sustainable cities that are clean, quiet, and free from pollution


**Are you ready to embark on the Voiage with us?**
 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft
description:
Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Microsoft Cloud services, where you'll design, implement, and manage cutting-edge Azure solutions, collaborate with talented professionals, and grow your career with personalized development plans and access to top-tier certifications.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft unique**
* Take ownership as a technical Lead in a specialized service area, shaping strategic solutions and driving innovation
* Cutting-Edge Technology Exposure: Work hands-on with Microsoft Cloud technologies like Azure, Power Platform, and DevOps, keeping you at the forefront of industry advancements
* Access personalized career development, Microsoft certifications, and holistic well-being support, ensuring both professional and personal success


 As a Senior Azure Engineer, you will work with delivery projects, maintenance, development, and life cycle management of our Managed Services platforms. The position also includes 3rd line level support, incident handling, change and problem management related to our European Portfolio under Cloud Services e.g. Azure Operate, Azure Migrate, Landing Zone and Azure Ready Assessment.
   

  

 My name is Heidi Storm, Head of Microsoft Cloud Services. As a leader, I am dedicated and transparent, always championing a "Win as a Team" mentality. I believe in fostering a welcoming, supportive, and solution-oriented environment where everyone can grow, collaborate, and make a real impact.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Public Cloud Consultant** 
**Microsoft**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing, implementing, and managing scalable cloud architectures using Microsoft Azure, while collaborating with development teams to enhance cloud-based services, automate operations, and ensure optimal performance and reliability.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering our Standardized Services efficiently and effectively. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams to ensure seamless implementation and customer success.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams, to develop, maintain, and successfully deliver customer projects
* Providing 3rd line support by handling incidents, managing changes, and solving complex problems within the European Portfolio to ensure seamless service delivery
* Developing and maintaining internal support tools to optimize workflows, streamline project deployments, and assist consultants in delivering high-quality solutions


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who is passionate about Microsoft cloud technologies, thrives in a collaborative environment, and enjoys solving complex technical challenges to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* 5+ years of experience in Microsoft cloud solutions, with a focus on Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and Microsoft server infrastructure
* A strong understanding of Azure services, including Virtual Machines, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure networking, Azure Backup, and Azure Firewall
* Experience with infrastructure as code utilizing ARM templates/JSON
* Knowledge of identity services like Windows Active Directory, Entra ID, and Entra ID domain services
* Proficient in English, as it is the main language used for all internal and external communications. Additionally, proficiency in one of the local languages spoken in Dustin’s operating countries (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, Dutch, Finnish, or French) is a plus


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with the recruiter Elza van Grootel- Coenraats
* 1st interview with Heidi Storm
* 2nd interview with Technical Lead from the team & Heidi Storm
* 3rd interview with Jonas Sjöberg (Director for Managed Services)


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel- Coenraats via e-mail

title: Senior Enterprise Architect - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**
**About Us**
 Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
   

  

 We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from healthcare to social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a strategic and visionary Enterprise Architect who can define, lead, and align our technology strategy across the entire healthcare platform ecosystem. In this role, you will
   

  

* Set the architectural direction for our platform products
* Oversee alignment across different products
* Ensure long-term scalability, interoperability, and maintainability
* Support international expansion into the wider European healthcare market


**You will engage directly with**
* Customers to explore new clinical and operational workflows, and digital transformation needs
* Partners to co-develop, integrate, and ensure compatibility within a modular platform ecosystem
* Product Management and Product Owners to align architectural vision with product strategies and roadmaps


**As an Enterprise Architect, you will**
* Define and evolve the enterprise-wide architecture for our healthcare platform products
* Align architecture across product teams, domains, and business stakeholders
* Drive adherence to healthcare standards such as openEHR, FHIR, and HL7
* Lead strategic architectural initiatives such as modularization, capability-based planning, and platform evolution
* Govern architecture principles and ensure compliance across all layers (business, application, data, and infrastructure)
* Act as a key advisor to business and product leadership regarding technology roadmaps and transformation programs
* Guide solution and software architects and foster collaboration across multidisciplinary teams
* Contribute to technology partner strategies, vendor evaluations, and interoperability initiatives


**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* Broad experience in enterprise architecture across complex product ecosystems
* Deep understanding of architecture principles / frameworks
* Proven ability to align business and technology strategies
* Familiarity with open digital health platforms and healthcare-specific standards (openEHR, FHIR)
* Experience designing scalable and modular architecture in cloud-native and containerized environments
* Leadership experience in driving change and enterprise-wide architecture governance
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including international and partner collaboration


**As a Person You Are**
* Strategic in your thinking and system-minded
* Collaborative and able to work across different teams, organizations and cultures
* Committed to excellence and long-term impact
* Curious, open-minded, and adaptable


**What’s in it for you?**
 With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
   

  

 Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.
   

  

**Could you be our new colleague?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Kari-Antti Kuosa (kari-antti.kuosa@tietoevry.com)
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

description:

**At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**
**About Us**
 Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software.  Are you passionate about leveraging modern technologies to revolutionize healthcare? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic and innovative team as a
 **Lead** 
**Software Architect** 
 ! We're a tech-forward company dedicated to enhancing health and social care through open platforms, ecosystems, and adherence to leading healthcare standards like FHIR and openEHR.
   

  

 We work in an agile, multinational organization that develops cutting-edge products and services for both public and private sectors across the Nordic countries. Our teams are committed to creating, supporting, and delivering modern solutions used by healthcare and social care professionals throughout the region.
   

  

 While we've listed several skills and experiences that we believe would be beneficial for this role, please don't be discouraged if you don't tick every box. We're primarily looking for a Lead Software Architect who is eager to learn and grow with us.
   

  

**With Us You Will Be Responsible For**

* Expertise in Healthcare Standards like FHIR, openEHR, and SMART on FHIR to ensure interoperability and compliance
* Visionary Architectural Skills to conceptualize and design holistic solution architectures that meet current and future needs
* Agile Methodology Proficiency, with experience working in agile environments utilizing methodologies like Scrum or Kanban
* Strong Technical Skills in microservices architecture, RESTful APIs, web development, and design patterns
* Programming Expertise, with excellent coding skills in languages such as C# and experience with frontend frameworks like Angular
* DevSecOps Experience, with exposure to integrating security practices into the DevOps process to ensure secure and reliable software delivery


**As a Person You Are**
* Solution-Oriented, always focused on finding effective resolutions
* Self-Motivated & Self-Organized, with the ability to manage your own tasks efficiently
* Independent and Responsible, capable of taking ownership of your work
* A Good Team Player, with attention to detail and the ability to collaborate well with others


**What’s in it for you?**
 With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. title: Operatör
description:
**Job Description**
**Om företaget**
*Sherwin-Williams grundades i USA 1866. År 2010 förvärvades tidigare Becker Acroma som sedan dess ingår i Sherwin-Williamskoncernen. Idag är Sherwin-Williams ett globalt ledande företag inom färgbranschen med egen tillverkning, utveckling och försäljning. Globalt är vi över 63 000 medarbetare varav 330 i Sverige fördelade på fyra orter med tillverkning i Märsta och Bellö, centrallager i Nässjö samt med en helägd återförsäljare i Vaggeryd. I Sverige fokuserar vi på industriell ytbehandling av trä och metall där våra enheter utgör en central roll av vår totala försäljning i Europa.*
**Responsibilities**
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker nu operatörer för sommarvikariat om 3 månader, med start i mitten av maj, till vår produktionsfabrik i Märsta. Som operatör kommer du att spela en viktig roll i vårt dagliga arbete genom att aktivt delta i produktionsprocessen och säkerställa att våra höga kvalitetsstandarder bibehålls. De huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifterna består av att tillverka färdiga produkter genom att noggrant följa angivna recept och instruktioner, hantera av maskiner och utrustning, truckkörning, genomförande av kvalitetskontroller samt att följa säkerhetsrutiner och arbetsanvisningar.
   

  

 Även om arbetet kräver självständighet kommer du att vara en del av ett härligt team där samarbete och kommunikation är av högsta prioritet. Det finns också goda utvecklingsmöjligheter inom företaget och vi har många duktiga medarbetare som jobbat länge inom företaget och som haft en imponerande utvecklingsresa.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Vem är du?**
 Ett krav för att vara aktuell för rollen är att du har truckkort A och B (helst B3), god fysisk förmåga samt att du talar och läser obehindrat på svenska. Du trivs i en industriell arbetsmiljö och förstår vikten av ett aktivt säkerhetstänk och att följa säkerhetsrutiner. Vi ser gärna att du har minst ett års praktisk erfarenhet av industri/produktionsarbete, men vi välkomnar även ansökningar från personer med erfarenhet av liknande branscher som är redo att lära och växa inom området. God datorvana är meriterande.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du chansen till en spännande tjänst i ett stort internationellt företag med många kontaktytor och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Genom kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och andra förmåner är vi en arbetsplats som värdesätter din trygghet och ditt välmående. Vi erbjuder en tidsbegränsad anställning om 3 månader med god chans till förlängning. Vidare kommer du att arbeta i skift, varannan vecka på förmiddagen (05.30-13.51) och varannan vecka på eftermiddagen (13.31-21.37). Observera att du kommer genomgå en nyanställningsundersökning inför anställning vilket bl.a. innefattar alkohol- och drogtest.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**About Us**
 At Sherwin-Williams, our purpose is to inspire and improve the world by coloring and protecting what matters. Our paints, coatings and innovative solutions make the places and spaces in our world brighter and stronger. Your skills, talent and passion make it possible to live this purpose, and for customers and our business to achieve great results. Sherwin-Williams is a place that takes its stability, growth and momentum and translates it to possibility for our people. Our people are behind the strength of our success, and we invest and support you in:
   

  

 Life … with rewards, benefits and the flexibility to enhance your health and well-being
   

  

 Career … with opportunities to learn, develop new skills and grow your contribution
   

  

 Connection … with an inclusive team and commitment to our own and broader communities
   

  

 It's all here for you... let's Create Your

 Eligibility to Work
   

  

 You will need to provide proof of right to work. It is a condition of any offer of employment we make to you that you have the permission to work in the country for the role for which you are applying for.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 An equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, colour, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnic or national origin, disability, age pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, or any other protected characteristic prohibited by law.
   

  

 Please be aware, Sherwin-Williams recruiting team members will never request a candidate to provide a payment, ask for financial information, or sensitive personal information like national identification numbers, date of birth, or bank account numbers during the application process.

title: Analytiker med fokus på kritisk infrastruktur och teknikutveckling
description:
**Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap**
 MSB arbetar för ett säkrare samhälle i en föränderlig värld med fokus på utveckling av det civila försvaret. Vi stärker Sveriges förmåga att fungera i kris och till och med krig. Det betyder att alla våra medarbetare bidrar till beredskap och motståndskraft. Från norr till söder sprider vi kunskap och agerar för att skydda liv och hälsa, samhällets funktionalitet och grundläggande värden som demokrati, rättssäkerhet och mänskliga rättigheter. Den 1 januari byter vi namn till Myndigheten för civilt försvar .
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla Sveriges civila försvar? Då kanske du är vår nästa kollega!
   

  

 Enheten för strategisk analys och utvärdering ansvarar för att ta fram centrala beslutsunderlag för att stödja utvecklingen av det civila försvaret i Sverige. Bland de återkommande uppdragen finns analyser av nationella risker, förmågor och sårbarheter som ger en bild av vilka utvecklingsområden som är viktigast att ta itu med. Enheten följer även upp och utvärderar centrala satsningar som görs inom beredskapen.
   

  

**Ditt ansvar och dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Som analytiker leder, planerar och genomför du analysuppdrag som ligger till grund för styrning och inriktning av Sveriges civila försvar. Du arbetar ofta i uppdrag tillsammans med andra analytiker på enheten, både självständigt med egna delar och ibland som sammanhållande projektledare. Analysuppdragen kan variera över tid men en viktig grund är strukturerad inhämtning, bearbetning, analys och bedömning av information som sedan ligger till grund för slutsatser till stöd för olika beslutsfattare. Arbetet kan även innebära att delta i utvärderingar som enheten genomför. Arbetet innebär samverkan med kollegor inom MSB och med samhällsaktörer utanför myndigheten. Även deltagande och utbyten i internationella nätverk kan förekomma. Du presenterar och företräder analyser som du själv eller enheten tar fram både internt och externt, och deltar även i metod- och processutvecklingsarbeten.
   

  

 I flera av våra analysuppdrag är studieobjekten de tekniska infrastrukturer som utgör viktiga samhällsfunktioner t.ex. elektroniska kommunikationssystem eller dricksvatteninfrastruktur. Även teknikutvecklingen i samhället i stort är viktig att beakta i våra analyser då den kan vara både riskdrivande och förmågeskapande. T.ex. behöver vi följa utvecklingen inom områden som autonoma system eller digitala världar. Våra analyser bygger ofta på underlag från beredskapsmyndigheter med särskilt ansvar för tekniska infrastrukturer och även om vi inte behöver ha detaljerad kunskap om dessa så behöver vi kunna förstå och använda underlag som är av teknisk natur. Den kontext som underlagen behöver passa in i är ofta policynära och kräver en god förståelse för den offentliga förvaltningen i Sverige i allmänhet och det svenska beredskapssystemet i synnerhet. Vi behöver stärka vår förmåga att arbeta med tekniskt orienterade underlag och söker med denna annons
 **en** 
**teknikintresserad samhällsvetare eller samhällsintresserad tekniker** 
 som kan komma att fokusera på sådana studieobjekt och fenomen.
   

  

 Då myndigheten och avdelningen är i kraftig utveckling kan arbetsuppgifter av projektledande, utredande och stödjande karaktär på andra enheter bli aktuellt under anställningen.
   

  

**Dina kunskaper och kompetenser**
 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* akademisk utbildning som arbetsgivaren finner relevant, gärna mot något tekniskt område t.ex. en ingenjörsutbildning
* erfarenhet av analys- och utredningsarbete
* goda kunskaper om krisberedskap och civilt försvar


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att ha följt eller arbetat med tekniska system, inom IT och/eller storskalig teknisk infrastruktur
* teknikintresse och kunskap om teknikutvecklingen i samhället, särskilt avseende IT och/eller storskalig teknisk infrastruktur
* erfarenhet av utvärderingsarbete
* erfarenhet av metod- och processutveckling
* kunskap om metoder för förmågebedömningar, riskbedömningar, scenariobaserad planering, framtidsanalys, utvärdering eller uppföljning av åtgärders effekt/effektivitet
* erfarenhet av att använda generativa ai-verktyg som stöd i planerings- och analysuppgifter


 Som alla medarbetare och ledare hos oss förväntas du kunna arbeta uppdragsorienterat, utvecklingsinriktat, dialoginriktat, ha god självkännedom och bidra genom att vara ett föredöme.
   

  

 Utöver dessa så vill vi att du som sökande till denna tjänst särskilt ska ha en
 **god helhetssyn** 
 genom att ta hänsyn till det större perspektivet i det analytiska arbetet. Vidare är det viktigt att vara
 **flexibel** 
 och kunna anpassa synsätt och förhållningssätt utifrån vad det analytiska arbetet kräver. Det är slutligen viktigt att ha
 **god språklig analytisk förmåga** 
 då det analytiska arbetet kräver förståelse för komplicerade språkliga underlag och att kunna producera text av hög kvalitet.
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Vi erbjuder dig en anställning tillsvidare på heltid som inleds med en provanställning.
   

  

 Du kan välja att ha placeringsort Karlstad eller Stockholm. Resor i anställningen förekommer.
   

  

 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för anställning på MSB då den innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. De flesta medarbetare på MSB är krigsplacerade.
   

  

**Om oss**
 På enheten för strategisk analys och utvärdering är vi ca 20 medarbetare och vi finns i både Karlstad och Stockholm. Enheten leds av en chef som är placerad i Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi har aktivitetsbaserat kontor där du kan välja arbetsplats efter egna behov.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig också en möjlighet att ta ut friskvårdstimme och du får även ett friskvårdsbidrag. För dig som statligt anställd finns också förmånliga semestervillkor.
   

  

 Alla vi som arbetar på MSB förväntas och ska bidra till ökad jämställdhet och likabehandling för en arbetsmiljö och ett samhälle fritt från diskriminering.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta
 **enhetschef Jim Kronhamn eller verksamhetschef Helén Jarlsvik.** 
 Fackliga företrädare Jörgen Mählér (Saco-S), Alexandra Grundel Lauritzen(ST) och Ann-Britt Paradis (SEKO). Samtliga nås via växelnummer 0771-240 240.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 12 augusti 2025.**
**Anställningsform** 
 Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Tillträde** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Löneform** 
 Månadslön
   

  

**Antal lediga befattningar** 
 1
   

  

**Sysselsättningsgrad** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort** 
 Karlstad eller Stockholm
   

  

**Län** 
 Värmlands län
   

  

**Land** 
 Sverige
   

  

**Referensnummer** 
 2025/146
   

  

**Publicerat** 
 2025-06-08

title: Trade Compliance Specialist
description:
**Passionate people create exceptional things**
 Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? Electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. We´re everywhere! Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations. With our inclusive and caring environment, you get the support and inspiration you need to grow. Here, your ideas are embraced, and you never stop learning. Interested in being part of our team?
 **Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.**
 As Trade Compliance Specialist, you are working in a team of 2 people, reporting to the Trade Compliance Lead. You will be responsible for export and import compliance policies and procedures within Atlas Copco Industrial Technique, ITBA.
   

  

 The position emphasizes import/export compliance issues that may arise and includes interaction with internal legal counsel and government officials as well as cooperation with R&D, sourcing, production units and customer centers.
   

  

 The position involves day-to-day work as well as work of strategic nature.
   

  

**Mission/Responsibilities**
* Continue to develop and improve the Internal Compliance Program, including export/import policies and procedures for ITBA
* Make sure exports/imports take place compliantly, meeting corporate compliance standards as well as legal requirements.
* Conduct regular assessments to identify risks and corrective actions
* Analyze, monitor, communicate and implement updates in customs legislations and international trade legislations
* Drive change management within ITBA on global trade compliance through education of other functions
* Develop a Trade Compliance Training Program including developing and delivering training packages
* Provide advisory support to ensure that all applicable items are classified for export and import in accordance to existing regulations e.g. Country of Origin, HS codes and ECCNs
* Export license determination and applications
* Screening against Denied Party Listing


**Knowledge/Experience**
* You have approximately 5 years’ work experience within trade compliance.
* Strong working knowledge and experience applying EU/US or other international customs and export control laws and regulations, familiar with HS, ECCN and sanction classifications.
* Experience of working with Denied Party Screening.
* Demonstrated ability to focus on project work and efficiently bring projects to completion.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills (Swedish and English).
* Advanced experience with MS Office, specifically MS Excel.
* SAP GTS knowledge and experience is a plus


**Educational Requirements**
 A completed Bachelor’s/Master Degree or similar in a relevant field (International Business and Trade, Logistics, etc.).
   

  

**Personality Requirements**
 As a person you are structured with attention to details and are having strong analytical skills. You are a flexible team player and motivator with leadership skills and ability to lead and train cross-functional teams. Furthermore you are self-driven with proven ability to work on multiple tasks and must possess ability to make sound judgments with confidence.
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 At Atlas Copco, we have a friendly, family-like atmosphere and a culture known for respectful interaction, ethical behavior and integrity. We offer opportunities to grow and develop, as well as potential to see your ideas realized and make an impact. As part of the Atlas Copco Group, you have access to global job opportunities.
   

  

 Listen to our co-workers what it is like to work for Atlas Copco Industrial Technique. You find a 15 min podcast here (in Swedish): Co-workers about their job in Atlas Copco
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Our office is situated in Sickla, Stockholm.
   

  

 The selection process will be ongoing and the position may be filled before the last application date, so don't hesitate to apply!
   

  

**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**
 Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

title: Senior Data Architect, Data and AI - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**Senior Data Architect - Tietoevry Care, Data and AI**
**At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**
**About Us**
 Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
   

  

 We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
   

  

 In Tietoevry Care’s Data & AI unit we are reshaping Nordic healthcare and welfare services by providing our customers with advanced data-driven applications, AI solutions and cloud data platforms. Our Data & AI team consists of high-end professionals working in data science, data engineering, data advisory, cloud solutions, security and software development. We are a growing international team of talented, continuously improving experts. With us you get to work with latest technologies, innovative products and create wellbeing for the Nordic societies.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a
 **Senior Data Architect** 
 with a passion for data to join our team. In this role, you will take a leading position in designing, implementing, and orchestrating advanced data and analytics solutions for the healthcare, welfare, and life science sectors in Sweden.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**
* Collaborating closely with our customers to understand and analyze their requirements, ensuring that our solutions meet their expectations and deliver significant value and benefits to patients.
* Acting as a trusted advisor, effectively communicating and sharing your knowledge with customers.
* Engaging with our technology partners and utilizing their globally leading cloud and data products.
* Working alongside fellow architects, DevOps teams, product management, and local sales to drive success.
* Hands-on data modeling and supporting the team with best practices and your knowledge of health care data in Sweden


**Ideally You Possess The Following Competences And Abilities**
* Experience in technical roles within complex data environments.
* Knowledge of welfare or health data in Sweden
* Proficiency in data modeling, SQL, ETL processes and data warehouse concepts.
* Good written and oral communication skills in English, fluency in Swedish is mandatory.
* Mindset for continuous learning and professional growth.


**It Would Be Great Bonus If You Also Had**
* Experience in modern software engineering and software product development, particularly in distributed organizations.
* Understanding of data governance, security, compliance, and privacy regulations within Sweden and the EU.
* Knowledge of major big data solutions including Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Kafka, and Delta Lake.


 To get a glimpse what We are proud of do check following links:
   

  

* Data Platform for Health - (http://youtu.be/AkXaCc350C4)
* Patient 360 application - (http://youtu.be/5NP9JrL88c8)
* Clinical trial matching for leukemia - (http://youtu.be/viI7O1yrz4M)


**What’s in it for you?**
 With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ once a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. Join us in the arena of healthcare IT with many possibilities and many internal career and development opportunities. We learn and grow every day and are truly motivated to help the healthcare sector! If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact Solution Lead
   

  

**John Lamb (** 
**John.Lamb@tietoevry.com** 
**)**
*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Head of Group Financial Control
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
*SJR har fått förtroendet att hjälpa vår kund Hubexo ett snabbväxande internationellt bolag i Private Equity-miljö, att rekrytera en erfaren och strategisk ledare för att bygga och utveckla en koncerngemensam ekonomifunktion. Det här är en unik möjlighet för dig som vill ta en nyckelroll i en organisation där finansfunktionen står inför en spännande förändringsresa och där du får vara med och forma framtidens struktur och arbetssätt.* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 I denna nyckelroll har du det övergripande ansvaret för att leda och utveckla Finance Operations, inklusive redovisning, skatt, koncernkonsolidering och rapportering, samt ett mer avgränsat ansvar för legala frågor och Facility Management. Du leder ett globalt team, med 7– 8 direktrapporterande redovisningschefer, och säkerställer att koncernen har en enhetlig och skalbar finansstruktur som stödjer bolagets tillväxt.
 



  





 En central del av ditt uppdrag blir att driva och genomföra ett omfattande ERP-byte, harmonisera processer och säkerställa en smidig integration av förvärvade bolag. Med din erfarenhet av förändringsledning i globala organisationer spelar du en avgörande roll i att skapa effektiva arbetssätt och bygga en stark, samarbetsdriven finansfunktion.
 



  





**Lämplig bakgrund** 




 • Erfaren koncernredovisningschef.
 



 • Dokumenterad bakgrund inom Finance Operations i internationella och snabbväxande bolag, gärna inom Private Equity.
 



 • Stark förändringsledarkompetens, med förmåga att bygga team och skapa struktur i en komplex organisation.
 



 • Erfarenhet av integration och förvärv.
 



 • En strategisk och affärsdriven approach, med förmåga att säkerställa en effektiv och framtidssäkrad ekonomifunktion.
 



 • Meriterande om du har erfarenhet från SaaS, IT eller börsnoterade bolag.
 



 • Meriterande med erfarenhet av att leda ERP-implementationer och digital transformation inom finans.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder Hubexo** 




 Den här rollen erbjuder dig en unik möjlighet att leda en omfattande transformation av en global finansfunktion. Du får arbeta i en internationell miljö med strategiskt inflytande i en Private Equity-ägd koncern. Rollen ger dig stor påverkan genom att driva ERP-implementation och harmonisering av processer, samtidigt som du leder ett starkt team i en organisation med höga ambitioner och snabb tillväxt.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vår kund med SJR. För mer information om rollen är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig Researchkonsult William Lindbom, william.lindbom@sjr.se eller Rekryteringskonsult Therese Kraft, therese.kraft@sjr.se.
 



  





 Alla intresseansökningar och kontakter hanteras konfidentiellt.

title: Sr. Database Specialist SA, AGS-EMEA-Europe North
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about helping customers build database and cloud solutions? Come join us !
   

  

 At Amazon, we've been investing deeply in building the right solutions that allow you to derive the most value from your database infrastructure. AWS is looking for a solutions architect for our Database team, who will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) helping customers to design complex solutions. As part of the team, you will work closely with Europe North customers across industry verticals (Financial Services, Media and Entertainment, Manufacturing, Technology, Health Care and Life Sciences, Retail, etc.) to enable large-scale use cases and drive the adoption of advanced AWS services. You will interact with other Solution Architects in the field, providing guidance on their customer engagements, and you will develop white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers to fully leverage AWS.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As a key member of the AWS Europe North Specialist Solutions Architecture team your work will include:
   

  

* Working closely with our product and field teams and 3rd party model providers, you will help enable new capabilities for our customers to develop and deploy data workloads on AWS infrastructure
* Design best in class database infrastructure solutions for all stages of customer and product lifecycles.
* You will have the technical depth and business experience to deploy database and data strategies.
* Partner with SAs, Sales, Business Development and Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment.
* You will also work closely with account teams, research scientists, and product teams to drive model implementations and new solutions.
* Thought Leadership - Evangelize and share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Summit, AWS re: Invent, etc.
* Act as a technical liaison between customers and the AWS teams to provide customer driven product improvement feedback.
* Develop and support an AWS internal community of related subject matter experts.


 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 Knowledge of AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals
   

  

 Knowledge of cloud architecture
   

  

 Deep knowledge and experience on at least one commercial relational database (Oracle, SQL Server, IBM2), or open source database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB)
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
 Cloud Technology Certification (such as Solutions Architecture, Cloud Security Professional or Cloud DevOps Engineering)
   

  

 Knowledge of non-relational databases such as mongodb, couchdb, redis
   

  

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
